intro: Astragalus bequaertii, commonly known as the Bequaert's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, harsh environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations. Astragalus bequaertii is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
